Class PhilipMCS5SoftwareDevelopmentNeuralNetworkTrain

  • java.lang.Object

    This is the main class used to train my chess neural network.
    Author:
    mortimer

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method used to train the neural network
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments

      • formatDataForStockfish

        private static void formatDataForStockfish()
        This method is used to generate a training and test data set using stockfish (the world's strongest chess engine) as the ground truth evaluation of a board state. Essentially, the code loops through all board states stored and stores the stockfish evaluation along with a computer friendly chess board representation. This code was not used as the code would take too long to run (as stockfish needs a minimum amount of time to evaluate each board state with any accuracy). This method would prove effective given more computer resources.

      • getTrainingData

        public static int[][] getTrainingData()
        Gets neural network training data.
        Returns:
        The training data

      • getTestData

        public static int[][] getTestData()
        Gets the test data from the test file.
        Returns:
        The test data

      • formatDataCompare

        private static void formatDataCompare()
        Formats data for a neural network comparing the value of boards. The idea behind this was that the network would compare two board states and determine which one was better. This process was not used as it proved too inefficient computationally.

      • formatData

        private static void formatData()
        Raw fen strings from each file are converted into data in a format that can be input to the neural network. This method was used and this method labels board states in a game of chess that was eventually won as positive and vice versa. This approach produced a high accuracy although it was limited by the hardware used to train it. It was also limited by the fact that the dataset of boardstates is not as strong as previously thought.

      • shuffleArray

        private static void shuffleArray(java.lang.String[] arr)
        Randomly shuffles inputted array
        Parameters:
        arr - The array to shuffle
